title: Miracema
text:
Miracema () is a <a href="Municipalities%20of%20Brazil">municipality</a> located in the <a href="Rio%20de%20Janeiro%20%28state%29">Rio de Janeiro state</a>'s northwestern region, bordering <a href="Minas%20Gerais">Minas Gerais</a> state, <a href="Brazil">Brazil</a> and with a population of 27,154 inhabitants living in an area of 302.5 km2. Its main economic activities are agriculture and milk production.
History.
In the early 20th century, <a href="coffee">coffee</a> was the city's most important economic activity, and Rio de Janeiro state was the greatest coffee producer of the country.
Sports.
Brazilian <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> manager <a href="Aymor%C3%A9%20Moreira">Aymoré Moreira</a>, and his brothers, <a href="Zez%C3%A9%20Moreira">Zezé Moreira</a> and <a href="Cruzeiro%20Esporte%20Clube%23Former%20coaches">Ayrton Moreira</a>, who were also managers, were born in the city. "Miracema Futebol Clube" is a city's football club.
